intro: Werauhia diantha, commonly known as the pink werauhia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cavity. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its foliage is often variegated, featuring a mix of green and white tones. Werauhia diantha thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests.
